metadata.title: CVE-2018-6149 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Type confusion in JavaScript in Google Chrome prior to 67.0.3396.87 alloweda remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory write via a craftedHTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
